description: Ladies and gentleman, you'd better bring a freaking seat belt because this sushi is about to blow you out of your gosh darn seat. Feel the wrath of the dragon roll or mash a classic California roll deep inside your orifices. Bathe in edamame as the soy sauce showers your innocent pallet. Everybody else that rates this place less than 5 stars needs a strong shaking and a firm talking to. But seriously it's really good.
author: Fionn R.

description: They used really bad cuts of fish on my roll. Probably on the verge of being thrown out. You would think they would stuff just the bad pieces inside the roll, but the bad pieces were on top too. Got a stomachache after.
author: It's M.

description: Food is palatable but at this price it should be delicious. Not terrible but when you pay $24 for tempura and there is only one shrimp and the rest are cheap vegetables, something is not right. Tanuki is like an animal that can change shape, a badger appearing as a prince. That about sums it up.
author: Chou K.

description:
How in the world did this place get 4 stars? My boyfriends friend is a regular here and recommended us over. The restaurant was pretty empty for a Saturday night. That should've been a sign but since we heard such glowing reviews, we decided to try this place. Waitresses were very friendly and pretty attentive. Now on to the food.

Uni: vibrant colors and very creamy texture. Not the best I've ever had but definitely pretty good. It's funny cause I heard one of the chefs say in honest "Uni is very fresh but I'm not too sure about everything else" 

Oyster shooters: oyster wasn't very fresh. Even with all the sauce, I could still taste the funky after taste.

California roll: $8.50 for 6 pieces? They used real crab which was well blended with the mayo, but I still can't justify that pricing. 

Beef teriyaki: we order medium rare and they gave us rare. My boyfriend was ecstatic about the rare steak but I definitely would've done without this dish. 

Toro: it had that melt in your mouth texture which was great. 

Lobster tempura: saltiest tempura I've ever had in my entire life. It felt like the chef accidentally knocked over a salt shaker on to the batter and just decided it wasn't worth his time to start over. My boyfriend and I aren't ones to waste but we only had one piece each and couldn't bring ourselves to finish it. 

Really wanted to like this place but it's a no go for me.
author: Ada H.

description:
You MUST get their cold noodle salad. If it doesn't come with your meal, you should definitely order it as a side. It is my favorite thing here.

I usually get the beef teriyaki or an udon bowl. They put a lot of teriyaki sauce and also make the beef pretty tender. Their noodles are not too chewy and the soup is delicious. 

It is nice that some of their entrees come with the cold noodle salad and the miso soup. It's definitely a good deal. 

Their unagi is so soft and just melts in your mouth. 

I would definitely recommend trying this place.
author: Allyson L.

description: Had various kinds of sushi from this spot at an event tonight. California, salmon, tempura, avocado...all good.
author: Denise C.

description:
Good friendly, fast service. The chefs are Chinese and not Japanese. The nigiri is decent and not the best. Good selection of hot and cold food on the menu. Good selection of sake. A little pricey for what it is. They have a TV and usually some sport/game is playing. 

The ankimo was a bit old. Masked by the sauce but without the sauce there was an odd odor. The tempura was the was freshest thing here. We ordered the noodle salad and it came out less than a minute later. 

Overall it's a good family place, not so much date night type, you hear everyone in here.
author: Anyta L.

description:
Great neighborhood sushi for lunch. 

We wanted a walking distance sushi bar open for early lunch. This place for that bill. Luckily, the fish was also fresh and the service was fast. 

They have lunch specials and a lunch menu. I had the sushi and salmon kama combo. The salmon kama was very good. I liked that they gave salmon skin roll instead of California roll with the sushi. 

We ordered the chicken karaage for my son. It was so good that my husband kept stealing it. Perfectly fried tender meat. 

My husband had the tempura and said it was very good.
author: michelle l.

description:
Good little place for sushi. Looks like majority of the sales come with to go orders. And I overheard that you will get a free California roll with your order. Score! 

We ate at the sushi bar. Welcoming service. Fast sushi preparation. 

Two rolls and one sashimi combo was just enough for us.
author: Anelya S.

description:
My experience on Oct. 26 was heartbreaking.  

It was a beautiful day and the entire city was in wonderful mood, so was I.  When I arrived at 1:30pm, the restaurant was full.  Patrons were drinking, chatting, eating, laughing,...The sushi chef behind the bar asked me to sit down.  After a long wait, the waitress (short hair, Asian) came out from the kitchen.  She told me to leave because they were closing early.  She then walked to a table of four and took their order.  I should have left right away, but, it took me two MUNI buses to get there and I was starving.  Without dignity, I asked her if I could order to go?  She pointed to the door and told me to go the restaurant across the street.  I left shaky and couldn't eat anything for hours.

I have been a loyal customer for more than 12 years, despite the changes the restaurant has gone through.  In addition, am a generous tipper because I waited tables while I was in college, have always tipped 25%+.  I simply can't figure out how I deserve this treatment.
author: Ni P.

description: It was a quiet Saturday night when we walked in. I ordered the chirashi and my friends got the sukiyaki with a roll. The chirashi was delicious. It was fresh and tasted great! The atmosphere wasn't too loud. It's an older place but the prices were reasonable.
author: Kim N.

description:
Best sushi around. Great portion sizes and amazing quality. Highly recommend. 

Such great combination meals and sushi. Servers are very attentive and nice.
author: Claire B.

description:
Came back after moving away for a few years. Clearly change in ownership! What a disappointment! Nothing seemed fresh. Menu items were still generous in portion but they make up for it in cost. I came in close to closing and definitely felt rushed. One of my party got sick after eating monk fish liver but in fairness, it could have been elsewhere that he ate as he ate out all three meals that day. He was the only person to eat monkfish.

Sigh....I was so looking forward to my weekly visits here again but I will have to find a new place.

One last note is take a look at the age of reviews... you will see that most of the reviews that have given this place a high-rating occurred years ago....clearly the changing ownership impacted the quality
author: John D.

description: A hidden gem tucked away off of Clement St. Food is high quality, affordable, and delicious! The service was great and the owner is always working behind the sushi bar and never fails to greet each party.
author: Katie W.

description: Ordered takeout last night. Overall the food was okay. Had a dinner, a roll and some starters. Roll and main entree were good, but I was so disappointed to find mayonnaise noodles with my dinner instead of rice. That was unexpected and really put me off. I had to make rice thus delaying my meal and I was starving. Now I know.
author: Denise M.

description: Tanuki is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in the Inner Richmond! My husband and I typically resort here for dinner at least once a month when we're craving something light and fresh. It's a small restaurant but we usually get seated right away and the service is fairly quick. You can't go wrong with the sushi rolls- salmon being my favorite fish, I usually go with the Dream Roll and Tokyo Roll. However, if you're not a raw fish person, Tanuki has filling Donburi bowls ("rice bowl dish" typically consisting of fish, meat, or vegetables served over rice) and Udon; the Katsu Donburi and Tempura Udon both being great to share. Tanuki is a winner in my account!
author: Grace L.

description:
I visited Tanuki with my family, and while the food was ok, be warned: IF YOU HAVE A PEANUT ALLERGY, THE MISO DRESSING IS PEANUT!!!!! 

This ruined our meal. Typically I ask, but didn't on this occasion and peanut was NOT in the description for the salad dressing. Big mistake. I spent the rest of the meal taking benedryl and wondering if I would need to visit the ER.
author: Kath v.

description: Great place for sushi in the inner Richmond district. A small and cozy venue with table seating and sushi bar seating for 7. Their menu has various selections of hot and cold foods. I was there during lunch hour. There is a special lunch menu including bento boxes and combination selections ... great value. Service was great and quick.
author: Cathy F.

description:
I heard good things about this restaurant so I decided to give it a try. 

I ordered agedashi tofu, sashimi combo (14 pcs) and the poki roll. 

The agedashi tofu was so unauthentic. It basically fried tofu in tempura batter and a watery sauce, in which they put such a little amount of sauce it seemed like they were on a budget or something. Like there was HARDLY any sauce in the agedashi tofu. On top of that the agedashi tofu batter was soggy and rubbery. 

The sashimi was so so, didn't taste extremely fresh and was actually kind of rubbery. 

The poki roll was nothing special. It was really plain and extremely simple, and the texture of the fish was kind of tough and did not taste fresh. 

I didn't even finish half of my food before I asked for the check. 

I wanted to like this restaurant because I heard it was really good, but was disappointed. The only reason why I'm giving it 2 stars is because the sushi chef behind the counter was nice enough to take my order because the waitress was busy going back and fourth with a large group of people. I don't think I'll be back here.
author: Amanda R.

description: Change in ownership occurred quite a while ago and it has been a huge disappointment. So sorry that the previous owners are no longer around.
author: C K.

description: I love it that our favorite sushi chef broke away from his former employer and started his own thing. Tommy is serving up some great food in an intimate location. I would recommend calling ahead and getting a spot at the bar, but then you might be taking my seat. I would also suggest the halibut nigiri. Just save me a piece please.
author: Christopher C.

description: Recently I came back to tanuki and was really disappointed. The Uni shot wasn't as good as I remembered. The sushi are not that great - Mediocre rice and the fish didn't taste fresh. Will not come back any more.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
It's very rare that I am disappointed by a restaurant, but this place is now one of two I have to leave a bad review for. Service was incredibly slow (the place seems understaffed). It took a while for us to be seated even after the table they said was for us was cleaned up. We then had to wait relatively long again to be provided menus. It then took 30 minutes for our food to come out.

The food itself is way overpriced for the quality. Each ingredient in each roll was hardly noticeable, from the tobiko on one roll to the shrimp on another. We ordered 4 rolls and 2 of them looked the same. The chirashi bowl my friend ordered also wasn't worth the $26 compared to the usual ~$20 bowl you can buy anywhere else.
author: Lydia H.

description: Ever since new ownership took over, this place has not been the same!  NEVER order the chicken teriyaki.  It USED to be the best, but now, NO white meat is served and you cannot identify the chicken parts.  I believe the new owners have decided to mash the bones, and saving little meat, shaped the parts and deep fried it so you are chewing on bones with scant meat.  I used to be able to identify the thighs, back, drumstick, breast, wing, et al, but now I can't tell what part of the chicken I am eating.  I am sure the former owner would die if he saw what happened to his delicious dish and the reputation of his name!!
author: Lillian W.

description:
To the windooooooooowww! To the bar! To the bar!

Some soosh is best experienced at the bar. #jirodreamsofokina (http://www.yelp.com/biz/okina-sushi-san-francisco?hrid=Iv3WI4QUyt1uiRfMIEgYfg) Other times, the window seat's where it's at. Tanuki Mario Down+B Restaurant is such a neighborhoody place that you'll best benefit from all the people watching happening outside during your meal.

Kinda wondering when the Horse Head Bed Roll will be on the specials board, seeing as how the Godfather concerto started playing as I ate, and obaachan's voice is a Japanese Vito Corleone. She might make you an onigiri you can't refuse...
author: Dan B.

description:
This was my go to Japanese restaurant for many years when I lived in the neighborhood.  I hadn't been in several years so I suggested to hubby we come for dinner tonight.    

Menu sticker price shock at dinner time.  $21.50 for combo sashimi and beef sukiyaki was steep for the portions served.  I attributed it to doing business in San Francisco.

Miso soup, noodle salad, rice, and the dinner combo. The noodle salad was ice cold and too peppery.  Not like how it used to be. And a soup spoon in the soup bowl.  We both thought that was a first for us in a Japanese restaurant. 

Hubby also had the dinner combo- sashimi with tonkatsu.  The tonkatsu was like a thin sheet of paper.  

The sashimi was fresh.  It came on a plate.  But no ginger.  And a tiny dollop of wasabi.  My sukiyaki lacked yam noodles. I might have had a few threads.  And where's my fish cake? And not authentic looking or in taste.  In the middle of our meal, a customer came in for take out order.  The waitstaff started speaking Cantonese to him.  Is the kitchen non Japanese.  That might have explained the change in the taste, the ingredients, and overall appearance of the food.  I'm not like that with other types of cuisine.  It's just something about Japanese food for me. 

A disappointing meal, both food wise and price wise.  We left still wanting something more to eat.

We went home and reached into the freezer for ice cream.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Another typical place with garbage service and average food. Couldn't be more disappointed. 

Fish isn't fresh at all. Your much better off going to other places in the Avenues. We left with a bunch of food on the table. What a waste.
author: Anthony O.

description: Great place to get fresh sashimi , with good portions. The service is very good, open late.
author: Philip N.

description: Excellent. Back a second time because we love it so much! Outstanding Fish, service & ambiance. We enjoyed an incredible 12 piece sake sashimi, some smoked salmon nigiri & a couple very fresh & hearty rolls. We bought two hot sakes & were treated with the third on the house. The chef was engaging & also treated us to two pieces of this aji sashimi that was on special. We were brought two very sweet oranges for dessert & will be back! We ordered a blue sea, harmony, northern, heavenly, bamboo, lobster hand roll & a crunchy roll on special. All we would order again.
author: Lindsey D.

description:
The sushi is okay but beware when you order take out.  They are very stingy with
rice and the avocado rolls are not always the freshest looking, (browning on top).
When a restaurant charges $2.50 for a very small container of rice and only fills it half
way it's hard not to feel ripped off.   When I called to complain the server said "I gave
you plenty of rice." Not good customer service and since there are more generous restaurants,
I won't be returning.
author: Diana Y.

description: Sushi is fresh and legit. Lunch specials are awesome and worth the price. I come here all the time and will keep coming back
author: aaron t.

description:
Food was good 
The only bad thing is 
We came around 9 pm
Order food. Everything nice
Around 930 pm they turn off the sign that they are open.
We're still were eating our dinner.
Then they told us to pay the bill and we can still enjoy our dinner. 
It was nice. 
We still had food on the table 
After we paid.  They started to clean the place with strong cleaning chemicals.
And it was impossible to stay to continue our dinner.
Basically they almost Force us to leave which was very rude and we had to leave because we could not stay due the chemicals cleaning smell.
Our eyes will start burning.

I have never seen such a service before my life.
Nobody told us they're very close to the closing time and wanted to get our order. 
They should have told us that they're closing up soon so we can have the choice to use their restaurant or hurry up.
We spent $170.
This is not the cheap place so we were expecting a better service.

Very unprofessional service
author: Yevgeny D.

description:
Whenever I'm in her hood, I report in advance, not because I needed her endorsement, more like I did not want her to feel that I did not want to see her. I was often with other people and I don't do well in a larger group. This is in her hood, and she's eaten Christmas eve dinner here just recently and liked it. My companion also suggested it after learning our original place was closed. I walked a few blocks to get here, on foot. It was a quiet early evening, the moon was hanging low, the air was warm and I was in a calm, contemplative mood. There were a few options on Clement, but I'm under strict order by another friend to avoid being on Clement between 5th and 9th, in case I might run into him and his family, and some awkward pleasantry and greeting might be contemplated. I don't do well with fake pleasantries either. So here we are. Seemly like a perfect dining choice for all the reasons listed.

But from the get go, there were a few issues with the ambience. Bright lights, like you are under interrogation. Not romantic nor stylish. It's obviously popular, the bar was filled so were the tables. This particular night there were a group of 4 and 5 occupying the entire bar and they were drunk and exceptionally loud. I pulled out the sound meter to measure, if any louder, my ears would go deaf. A popular restaurant like this should tell patrons to lower their volume, this would never ever be tolerated in a better managed restaurant. Sadly it was the loud mouth drunk bully night and it was clear we were not the only ones who were annoyed, other people did not like it too, but being this was a pleasant society we live in, no one said a thing. As the evening went on, they were becoming even more obnoxious, doing shots at the bar and thoroughly forgetting this is not their own living room, others were trying to have a conversation and enjoying their meals too. It felt like that we were stuck in an insane asylum with the inmates running it. 

Food was decent. The hamachi was palatable. The monk fish liver was relatively fresh. The rolls were good but not great. It's your stereotypical American style sushi joint with a lot of California style sushi, lots of mayo, lots of sauces to cover the less than best quality sushi. It lacked authenticity to say the least.

I understand this is a crowd pleaser from other reviews, but it's not outstanding. and the other obnoxious drunken loud diners really made the experience less than pleasant.

In the morning when we woke up we said to each other in unison, "last night those diners were really loud." It might not be good, it was certainly a memorable experience. The walk from 7th and Fulton was nice and leisurely. The food was decent... But I had expected more. 

They say Yelp reviews can be a hit or miss. For me, this is a miss. And I shall not return.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Small, cozy Japanese restaurant that has great oyster shots!  I went here for a birthday dinner and rest assured, we ordered plenty.  The oyster shots were the highlight!  Went down zesty, smoothly well!

The yellow tuna, hamachi and salmon sashimi was fresh!  Their unagi eel was cut thick with generous portions and hamachi Kama was grilled with moistness and great flavor! 

Service was good -  dishes were rolled out in a good amount of time!

A great place to enjoy Japanese food!
author: Tiffany D.

description: How this place managed to get 4 stars is beyond me. Came here on a Friday night & the service was terrible! We had to ask for plates and water multiple times, and the servers could barely keep up. I think they need more staff to manage the floor. The food was a little overpriced in my opinion. $60 for two rolls and a dinner set of sukiyaki and tempura. Won't be going back again!
author: M F.

description: Great sushi place. Knowledgeable sushi chefs, and friendly waitstaff. The sushi is thicker than at most restaurants I know. Spicy tuna roll is the real thing. Vegetables are fresh, as is the tea. We recommend this place highly.
author: Harry S.

description:
Overal, very satisfied! The restaurant is neat and clean, plus the servers are friendly and helpful.

They served you a house salads as a starter, very yummy sauce. I believed the sauce is house made.  We had another small plate, Beef Wrap with Asparagus, and I think the beef can be a little bit more tender. My hubby likes their Magic Roll (we requested it with Seaweed instead of Soy Paper). 
At the end, they had a small fruits as your dessert.
author: vsa L.

description: Really good sushi! One of my favorites! Employees are all really nice and helpful! Lunch is amazing for sushi lovers!
author: Alix V.

description:
Finally! A good udon place in the city!!  

I got the nabeyaki udon, and it was exactly what I was hoping for. The broth was very flavorful; many other places in the city have what tastes like salty water. Not this one! The noodles were nice and chewy. It came with an egg, shrimp tempura, many other vegetable tempura pieces, shiitake mushrooms, two fishcakes, and fresh snow peas. There was no shortage of goodies in my bowl!

I also ordered a caterpillar roll off the menu. I took one bite and was in heaven.  They were generous with the unagi, and it was moist and tender with just the perfect amount of fattiness. Great balance of how much avocado was used.  

My new go-to place, even if it is a bit out of the way!
author: Jaching H.

description:
We ended up here so randomly, and Tanuki turned out to be some of the best sushi I've had in SF, maybe anywhere. It's not a fancy place, just simple clean decor, a small sushi bar and cozy dining room. 

They do everything from donburi and udon, to classic and creative sushi rolls. Check out their sushi specials board, where all the seasonal stuff is. We tried the lobster hand roll, and a bunch of others. The fish was so noticeably fresh, I wanted to gorge more than usual. Beer, wine, and sake is on offer too. 

Service was not terribly speedy (we had to flag her down to ask for some mochi after our meal), but the quality of sushi and low-key atmosphere (no wait on a Friday!) made up for it. 

Tanuki is a more-than safe bet for raw fish cravings!
author: Nique F.

description: Again tommy came threw, excellent service and excellent quality. Couldnt have chose a better place to come for my birthday, seems like ive celebrated atleast 4 bdays with tommy so , ill start by saying my dinner was spectacular and as always i had the chep and spicy tuna handrolls and some extras , i share some pictures
author: T S.

description:
Used to live in the neighborhood so I had a lot of wonderful meals here back about 10 years ago.  Now, whenever I'm in the area I stop in for a meal, I love it.  I just ate here again last night.   Still feels like a cozy neighborhood place.   I sat at the bar which is probably the best seat in the house.  There were couples dining, and a few parties of four, and a few folks with young children - a really nice mix.  It looks like ownership changed over the last year but the quality is the same.  

Sorry to hear about the bad late night experience another writer had recently; that's really too bad because the quality of food and the staff is usually so high.  I hope the staff will address that problem.  I think Tanuki is a real SF jewel amidst many, many sushi restaurants in SF.
author: Lilliana S.

description:
Have you ever felt like dancing as hard as possible and finishing it with moon-walk because the food is good? I have here at Tanuki Restaurant.   
I have sushi at least twice a week for the nutrition.  

I love Tanuki Restaurant since they serve fresh raw fish.  Just one block from the busy Clement Street, this restaurant sits quietly. I visited this restaurant by myself for the 5th time the other day. Sushi on a chilly day? I must be crazy. 

I order the combination of nigiri sushi which cost around 18 dollars. I am not against sushi rolls, the great American sushi invention but I want to enjoy the original flavor of fish and that is all. Still I never order anything with spicy sauce since the sauce was originally invented to hide the bad color and the taste of old tuna. Have you ever wondered why we always see "spicy" and "tuna" side by side and not "spicy yellowtail or "spicy eel????"  At this restaurant, you can enjoy anything with spicy sauce without worries because the chefs are sincere and the fish is fresh. 

They serve a pot of green tea and pickles first and I like that. Green tea and sushi match very well. My nigiri sushi was beautiful on the white plate. Here comes my "zen" moment.  I closed my eyes and prepared for my eating sushi with the calmest mind. 
I usually have sushi in the order of "from subtle flavors to bold rich flavors" but there is no formal order to eat sushi. I usually turn nigiri 90 degrees so one of the chopsticks holds fish and the other holds the rice, and then dip it in soy sauce lightly. If you see something on your sushi, like mackerel here, you can't turn your sushi 90 degrees. The best way is to use your ginger piece as a soy sauce brush. It is a good sushi manner which doesn't cause a mess. 
 I may look cool to others but when I have sushi, I am very excited. Here was what I was thinking. 

Geoduck......(Hmmm, the subtle flavor of oceans as if I were sitting by the seashore) 
Octopus.......(Hello, Taurine. Go ahead, control my cholesterol!)
Tuna............(The beauty in red, lower my blood pressure, please.)
Salmon Roes..(Oh boy, they are dancing in my mouth. Delicious! )
Sea Urchin....(I can see the grain! This must be fresh. No bitter taste so this must be from Santa Barbara, not from the East Coast.)
Salmon & Yellowtail...(Gosh, they are so buttery and delicious!)
Mackerel......(O-M-G! They were cured very well and very fatty. No hint of fishiness. Hello, Omega 3, improve my blood circulation.) 

So I ended up ordering extra mackerel. Some Japanese people order egg sushi first to see how sushi is good at a restaurant but at some restaurants, they buy the egg omelet from stores so it always doesn't work. To judge the skill of sushi chefs, I recommend you order mackerel. Do they make home-made omelet here? Yes. When I was there, they were making it for dinner time and I received the sampler. It was good as well. 
I haven't tried many hot dishes here but if you like sushi, I highly recommend this restaurant. This restaurant is often visited by Japanese celebrities from Japan so if you see them, please get me their autographs! It is a little bit hard to find a parking space, but it is worth while visiting.
author: Manabu M.

description:
I came here with a party of 5 late in the evening on a weekday.  The place is tiny but we were seated after a couple minutes.  The menu and specials reflected very simple, home cooked Japanese food with no frills.

We ordered four udons, one katsu donburi and two rolls to share for an appetizer.  Hot green tea was brought out immediately.  I can't remember which rolls we ordered but they were pure fish, no extra fried or saucy components.  Whatever it was, it was really fresh and really good.  The udon came out and all conversation died, it was all slurp slurp slurp.  I don't eat udon very often but I would eat more if they all tasted like this.  I ordered the nabeyaki udon.  The broth is full of flavor but not too rich or heavy like ramen broth can be.  The udon noodles were nicely chewy.  There were tons of tempura pieces plus an egg.  My friend did not enjoy his katsu donburi but I wouldn't hold it against Tanuki.  He didn't know what it was before hand and didn't expect an egg cake on top of rice.

The service was good, udon was delicious an filling and I will definitely be back to have more of the sushi.
author: Emmi D.

description: Sushi here is always great. Very fresh and tasty. Service is up and down. Came for Mother's Day dinner and service was poor. Took forever to get a cup of water and difficult to even pay the check.
author: Alex L.

description:
Maybe it's just me, but I've always thought of Tanuki as an institution - it's been around since forever, and it looks mostly the same as it did years ago (other than periodic touch-ups).  It's small and quaint, but it just feels like a legit Japanese restaurant.  Plus, as far back as I can remember, Tanuki was my first experience with Japanese food.  Maybe that's why I love the stuff so much...or maybe it's just because it's good.

Growing up, I mostly stuck with Tanuki's combinations, but I usually go with their sashimi/sushi nowadays.  You can't really go wrong either way - the food is generally solid regardless.  The rolls are reasonably priced for the most part, though a few top out around $15 or so.  When I dropped in with my friend last night, we ordered four between us and they were all pretty decent.  None were fantastic, but the Tanuki (shrimp tempura topped with unagi, marinated eggplant and avocado) and Scallop Lover (spicy tuna topped with hotate and spicy tobiko) could have been with a tweak here or there (like using raw spicy tuna instead of cooked).

To get the best out of Tanuki though, the sashimi and their more "authentic" dishes are the route to go.  The sashimi is generally really fresh, and the cuts are tasty.  I haven't tried everything they have to offer, but their hamachi has been my favorite.  Also, the Uni and Oyster shots (with raw quail egg, lemon, and ponzu sauce) were awesome, and the Chawan Mushi we tried was terrific (though a little different since they use chicken instead of shrimp/seafood).

Depending on what you order, parts of their menu can be relatively pricey...but you also pretty much get what you pay for.  And considering they've maintained the same level of quality after all these years, it's not a terrible difference to get that type of consistency.
author: Mike L.

description:
Good but pricey. About $22 for beef teriyaki and tempura combo. They're pretty generous with their tempura but it was still a bit surprising to see the price. 

My other half got the chirashi. Definitely fresh and good tasting and again, generous portions, but pricey. 

I would come again! Just have the expectation to pay a little more :)
author: Stephanie L.

description: This is a great place to have dinner i kwon the boss an his wife they are very nice they alway give me something for free an they kwon my order each time i just set down that it will parking is little heard to fine sometime if u love Japanese food hve the sushi chef mike the susci boat it mix an it good i jave post some pic take a look see if u like ot then go try it out will hope u have a good evening
author: Miko A.

description: went to eat at this place and was seated at the back table next to the kitchen.i saw this 2 waitresses busing dirty plates and glasses and both of them did not not even washed their hands once and just pick up the food plates and serve it to the table.the towel that she used to clean our table was very dirty it left an oily streak in the table.dirty place to eat
author: Dolly R.

description:
Came here for dinner with the fam and it was surprisingly pretty tasty. We ordered some sushi rolls, salmon sashimi, and seafood udon. All were very good, especially the salmon where freshness was on point. 

Only complaints is that the sushi rolls (6 pieces) were kind of small for the price. I don't mind paying high prices for good food...but for $14 a roll, we got 6 pieces of bit size sushi. What we tried was good though, and would definitely order again if we go. Unfortunately I can't recall the names of all the rolls since we each picked one.

Service was efficient and quick. The dining room was almost empty when we went, which was very rare according to my sister. She says they normally have line out the door. It was 4th of july weekend...so maybe people are out of town. Anyway, it was a lovely, quiet dinner so my experience was pretty darn good.
author: Karen M.

description: Although people have mentioned that there was a change in ownership, the quality and essence of sushi is up to par. I grew up eating at Ebisu, top Japanese restaurant in San Francisco, and former sushi chef Tommy made me my favorite caterpillar roll. I was blessed to see him again at Tanuki. He is very top notched and highly gifted in sushi making. The first thing I did once I bumped into this restaurant was ordering Tommy's signature caterpillar roll. It remains as good as it once was when he made it for me as a little kid eating at Ebisu. Tommy is very generous and kind to his customer. I definitely bring my girlfriend and my mom there to eat on their birthdays!
author: Lance W.

description: Wait was long even though the table was open. Then food took 40 minutes. Then the check took another 20 minutes. Rolls were not filling at all. Left feeling very unsatisfied with the food and overall experience.
author: Christina C.

description:
A bit pricey, but well worth the money- very high quality sashimi and food, good service, and overall good vibes. 

I recommend the combos! We shared the Sashimi & Sukiyaki (beef & veggies in broth) combo ($20) and a House Special roll ($14). SO MUCH FOOD. We came in starving and still left with leftovers. The tuna sashimi were BIG FAT PIECES and OH SO FRESH and smooth. Yummmmy. The sukiyaki was good too with a generous portion of tender beef, but the broth overall was a bit oily. 

The House Special roll ($14) is worth it! It's filled with avocado and mango, and topped with avocado and sashimi pieces. YUM. 

I recommend sitting at the bar :) You can watch the sushi chefs work their magic!
author: Samantha C.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants with a good selection of sashimi, sushi, box lunches, noodles and donburi.  It has been rainy, so I am having their seafood udon noodle soup and sake.
author: Jeff P.

description: Been having sushi made by Tommy for many years when he was at Ebisu. Now that he owns Tanuki, his food is still excellent as always. Fresh, tasty and fun.
author: Gerald S.

description:
What a delightful spot that Yelp helped me find.  We showed up at about 6:30pm on a Tuesday night and had our choice of tables.  We decided to sit at the sushi bar since it was empty.  Within seconds we had a hot cloth to wash our hands and our drink order was taken.  Which leads to...

The Amazing:
+  Uni Shot.  Fresh, clean, creamy, citrusy, amazing.  The uni was so fresh and the ponzu and quail egg made the entire taste and mouthfeel out of this world.  I HIGHLY recommend it.
+  Fresh fish.  We had a few rolls - all of which were pretty wonderful.  The fish was incredibly clean tasting.  
+  Selection.  If you like sashimi or nigiri the selection is pretty great.  If you like rolls the options are pretty amazing.
+  The chef.  While not the most chatty guy on the planet he was friendly, skilled, and quick to smile. 
+  Friendly and helpful staff.  They were on top of it.  Water was refilled, plates were cleared, and they were always smiling.  Top notch.

The Good:
o  Decent selection of sake.  Not a ton of beer options.
o  The location is a hole in the wall and my initial reaction was a bit "hmmm... i'm not sure about this..." but the service and food made everything come together.

The Poor:
Nada!

I think we've found our local sushi joint and I couldn't be happier.
author: Andreas H.

description:
Another top sushi restaurant in my book! Kind of a hidden gem behind a bus stop on Cali Street. 

I'm sad I only discovered this place now since I'm moving to a diff state soon. All the fish is fresh and prices are reasonable too. The uni shot with quail egg, tobiko, and ponzu sauce is definitely worth it for $4.75. 

I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!
author: Alysha K.

description: A favorite lunch place for me.  They have good options for lunch and reasonably priced.  Good quality food and very nice service.
author: Kim P.

description: If you want to dine here, only try the sushi. Best sushi restaurant so far. As a previous Disney CM I'd like to say they make magic! The sushi chefs are all awesome.
author: Grizabella L.

description: If you like Japanese food, you will love Tanuki! This  place reminds me of a couple of places I got to experience in Tokyo. It's small, it's unassuming, it gets a lot of neighborhood folks and regulars -- and the food rocks, from the tea and miso soup to the amazing noodle salad. Honest, fresh, well-executed food, from sashimi to the clever sushi rolls. The fried chicken teriyaki is amazing, as is the unaju. It's been at least four years, and it's just as good, if not better. Just go!
author: Michael D.

description: went here for my bday dinner and wasn't super impressed by it. I got a large salad which was basicaly lettuce and some bell peppers for $7 - not worth it. We also got a sashimi plate and for the price it wasn't that great. cuts were small but fresh. It's a small place but service was decent. I was just expecting more for 4 stars.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Upon entrance, the friendly staff seated us at a table and brought us hot tea as we skimmed through our menu. I gazed over to the sushi bar and saw SO many delicious and fresh-looking fish! That's when I knew I had to order sashimi. Then I gazed upon their chalkboards showing their specials which sound delicious as well. Then we ordered...

Miso soup - hot and steamy miso soup with big chunks of soft tofu and wakame (seaweed). Mildly salted.

Soft shell crab - tempura-battered fried and served with lemon and tempura sauce. Really good.

Chicken Karaage - small plate of bite-sized fried chicken that is not too heavy for the stomach leaving you room to try other dishes.

Spicy Hamachi Roll - not spicy at all in my opinion, but I liked it regardless!

Sashimi Combo - choose between 14 or 20 pieces. Like I mentioned, it was really fresh and the pieces slide right off itself. not frozen!

Steamed clams in sake broth - clams were a bit small and was put inside a huge bowl of broth. decent.

Uni shot - This was served with a quail egg over sake along with the uni. Delicious!!!!

Sukiyaki - this dish was pretty big if you are ordering a lot of other dishes. This can serve 4 bowls. The beef was tender.

Hot Sake - you can order a small or large size. Perfect addition to the meal.

I was full to an extent, and left satisfied for the night!
author: Nancy N.

description:
After not coming back here for years, the quality of food and service is really bad.

First the service. Walked in and the menus, plates and utensils were just tossed on the table. The plates were wet too. After tossing the stuff on the table and asked 3 minutes later and when we said not yet, just turns around and continue watching the game.

The food was pricey for low quality. We went and got a few sushi rolls and the fish had water coming out (old fish being aged in fridge effect). The sushi were around $2 a piece, so quality should had been a lot better. Even my uni shot tasted aged. 

The place was fairly empty when we walked in and a couple tables that sat down after us, left before us. So this is what kind of quality this place has.
author: M C.

description:
I don't know, I've just never had a real drop-dead-dazzling experience here. Maybe because it's always for lunch and I'm maybe expecting too much, but it didn't give me what I was looking for, which is an amazing lunch. I'd honestly give it 3.5 stars but probably 3 just because it's not really the place for me.

Their lunch sets are actually a bit pricy for what you get. 12.50 for a box, I want something pretty fabulous. But when my salmon fillet came out that was part of my order, I was really disappointed to find that it was about the size of a couple of lighters next to each other. It did come with tempura, tuna sashimi, and other small japanese sides, but it just wasn't really for me. I don't know why, there's nothing particularly wrong with the place, I've just had better experiences elsewhere is all.

The fish itself is really great though. I like the specials that they get in as well on the board, definitely quality fish and types, but you get what you pay for, and I can get similar quality fish at other places that seem to fit my aesthetic better.
author: Cara O.

description:
My mom is an absolute regular at this joint so when I went to pick her up from work, she suggested this place. 

One of the few places in the Richmond where parking is pretty available. Don't get me wrong, they don't have their own lot or anything of the sort. But they do however have non-metered diagonal parking spaces and street parking. Don't be a bitch and say "that's it?!" because trust me, that's a big deal to have what I consider ample parking for this part of the city that spans at least 2 blocks. Free to boot! They are 2 hr limit, but c'mon that's amazing. Y'know how many quarters you'll save?

The place itself is pretty small. But not at all suffocating. Our waitress was so friendly and attentive. The food came out relatively fast. My mom always gets the same dish and she loves it so I can't comment on hers, but I enjoyed my rolls. I got the dragon roll and the crab avocado roll. Now the dragon roll was pretty average. My fault for ordering standard rolls. I should always stick to my rule of ordering the special rolls at sushi spots because each place takes pride in their special rolls right so y'know they have to be good. Taught ya something there ay? Anyways the crab avocado roll was also topped with salmon, lemon slivers and roe which is why it was $12.50. But it was worth it. Loved it.

I'll be back. Next time I need to explore the other special rolls offered. There were so many, but I just stuck to one just to see how it was. Now I know they're pretty good. Thanks for lunch, Mom! ;)
author: Abigail D.

description:
Reasonable prices for lunch.  Miso soup comes with the meal.  Decent bento box portions.  Tasty food.

I enjoyed the sushi lunch special for $12.  Would prefer one more nigiri in place of the 3 CA roll pieces.

Service was very polite, fast and efficient.  It was pretty busy, today.
author: Debbie T.

description:
We had dinner here and it was our second time.  My wife and sister-in-law ordered teriyakki beef and both meats were partially cooked, as if half of the grill was not working.  The meat was cold to the touch, so I think we shall move on and try other restaurants serving similar Japanese food.  

I am not one to send back an order because I heard what could happen behind closed kitchen doors and the sensitive ego of some chefs, cooks.  Some get offended with returned orders and behave inappropriately.  I heard of that from a former restaurant worker in an upscale restaurant, not to mention investigative TV reports with hidden cameras in suspected kitchens.
author: Anson D.

description: The door was wide open at 9:30pm, 30 minutes before closing and the sushi chef told me they were closed. That was very disappointing and upsetting since I've been to plenty of restaurants that have accepted guests in even 15 minutes before closing. Also the chef wasn't even Japanese but Chinese for a sushi restaurant!
author: Bets Y.

description:
If you've never had a California Roll with REAL crab meat, you should check out this place.

When you dine in, they bring you a complimentary cup of tea. You'll also receive some pickled cucumber and daikon to munch on while you wait for your food. This place isn't very big and wasn't too busy when I went there around 2 PM on a Wednesday.

While I was glancing over the menu, I noticed that they didn't have a crunchy California Roll available. I thought that I may have missed it on the menu, but the waitress told me they didn't have it. Even though they didn't have it on the menu, the waitress said they could make it for me. 

The California Roll was $6 and I was charged a $1 extra for my special request. I think that was a pretty good deal for 8 pieces. My friend ordered a lunch special for under $11 and she got a lot of items. I found it a little odd that her lunch special didn't come with rice. Anyhow, the service was wonderful and I would probably come back here again to try something new.

FYI they don't stay open all day so make sure you call them to see if they're open.
author: Thao L.

description: This is Japanese restaurant is always great with service . I ordered the scallop lover and Tokyo rolls very good and fresh . My wife like green tea too.
author: Run W.

description:
Tanuki!! I always come here with two of my besties.

I love their Teriyaki Don. It's slices of beef, onion, and snow peas. I get tired of the snow peas but I like em in it anyway lolol. they have this noodle salad that I really like, it's light in flavor but refreshing. Their sukiyaki is also very good.

Tanuki is a bit pricey but I have no problem supporting local neighborhood gems. They have weird hours so I would call ahead of time to make sure they're open!
author: Bianca W.

description:
I find it hard to like just about anything about this place. The only good part of the whole experience, I would say, was the miso soup and the nigiri. And maybe the Asahi on tap. I will also say that the chefs behind the sushi counter all seemed very nice and experienced. 

The only way I could describe the service would be annoying. I don't think the server meant bad, but he was a bit unprofessional, which caused a couple of awkward and unpleasant moments. I will spare you the details.

The tempura was okay, not as crispy as I would like; a bit soggy even. The selection of rolls is just laughable for a sushi restaurant in the 21st century. Most of the rolls have only 1-3 ingredients, and at an average price of $8, are WAY overpriced. Their rainbow roll, which is like the "fanciest" roll on the menu, is $16! Look, I understand the idea, it's not all about rolls. They "specialize" in sushi. But you know what; unless you're serving the best fish in town, I think you need plan B.  

I think they try to be original by renaming the philly roll to alaska roll... nuh uh! Until they update their carpeting, offer some rolls that are more evolved than something your mom would make if she were to attempt to make sushi for the first time, and replace the soap dispenser in the bathroom to something more modern than a dispenser from a 1950s elementary school, I will not be coming back. 

In summary; boring and overpriced japanese food in a drab place that could use some remodeling, in an area of town where there is lots of strong competition. Nice chefs and good quality fish.
author: Leo G.

description:
Let me first preface this by saying my post is entirely biased, as this restaurant holds a special little spot in my heart. My parents have been coming here since they first moved to the Bay Area, and we are well acquainted with the owner. That being said, it certainly doesn't change the fact that the food here is really DAMN good. We choose to make the trek all the way out to Tanuki to simply support Aki-san and his family and to eat some real quality Japanese food. I can still remember my first experience here, stopping in for lunch with my dad while he was on business in the city. I was about 6 or 7 and we sat at the bar since there was a Giants game on. And I still remember how fresh the sushi was, how good the miso soup was, how crispy and juicy my tonkatsu was! For me, nothing's changed, in fact it's probably gotten even better. 

This review isn't to high light any particular experience I've had at this establishment, because there have been several. We celebrate birthdays, graduations, and host people from out of town here. The service is always great, and I suppose that could be due to the fact that we have a history with this place but we've never felt neglected or unwelcome or bothersome to the staff. Recently, Aki-san has branched out in to trying more "American-ized" rolls that are certainly non traditional, but they are still delicious. I admire their tenacity and their willingness to adapt to the times and to their changing environment. Through ups and downs, this restaurant still remains and I hope that will never change either! 

What I recommend: A combination of both sushi items and cooked items, because they are both equally delicious here. In particular, the more subtle and traditional dishes. White tuna salad, agedashi tofu, buta the black pork special is absolutely divine, shiro maguro tataki, tonkatsu my personal childhood favorite lol, any of the fresh sushi / sashimi combos, and definitely try the white albacore/garlic/onion sushi roll special they have written on the specials board!
author: Mariko M.

description: Sushi chef and owner Tommy is awesome.  He makes some of the best sushi I've ever had.  Favorite is a tataki, seared albacore with onions and ponzu and his amazing " special" rolls.  Mellow atmopshere, will be going back soon.  Great fish. Great service and the creativity of what Tommy does with some of his dishes is the best.
author: Wally G.

description:
The sushi especially the sashimi is really good and fresh. Unless you get an udon or donburi, portions are small for rest of the items.  I ordered the Toyko roll (salmon, tuna, avocado) and the noodle salad. My friends ordered the chicken donburi and beef teriyaki/tuna sashimi combo. I loved the Tokyo roll! Noodle salad was good and refreshing. Tried some chicken donburi - it's sweet from the onions. Not really a big fan of savory food tasting sweet in general. Teriyaki beef entree was really small but not bad - I'd prefer the beef to be a little pink though. 

Overall it was a good meal and service was great! Lady was really nice, came out with plate of watermelon slices for us after we finished our meal.
author: Linda L.

description: Tanuki used to be good. It has significantly declined in food quality. I've eaten there twice in the last few weeks, and had stomach aches afterwards. The service is good, but the fish is not fresh. Not exciting. I think I'm done here.
author: cherie g.

description:
A tasty egg yolk from a quail 

A delicate piece of uni

Went on a date with a drop of ponzu and hand squeeze of lime 

The rush of the uni shot was sweet, sensuous and sour.

Divinely intertwined, worthy of contemplation in the midst of a charming ambiance by the sushi bar. 

Encore, hit me with the uni shot again as my palate rolled, jolted and awakened. 

Looking for the chase, the chef's choice of colorful sashimi teased and unpacked my most discriminatory imaginations. 

Some fresh, others not, hamachi super, impressed and impressed again. 

Intrigued and wanting more, the added uni nigiri and ikura were dreamy and extravagant. 

As I whisper to spill all the secrets, it was the torpedo lobster and tobiko handroll that was my fave of the night. 

Soup-wise, miso heaping, clams unrevealing. 

Finally too much salt as I waved to the chef and call it the night.

The end had me one eyebrow raised. 

Chef outstanding, food decent, service waned. Thanks to Yelper B.B, the walking bookmark who always has a place in mind.

Was the experience worthy and super fresh? 

Some sparks, few sigh, it was excitable enough as I look to return time after time. *3.5 stars*
author: Daniel L.

description: Really delicious. It is pricey. If you can splurge, you won't be disappointed. The sushi lunch special is yummy. The albacore toro perfect. I can't wait to come back.
author: Tira S.

description:
So I finally got to try and out the sushi at Tanuki with my friend Amy N.  We went after a quick visit to the Academy of Sciences where seeing all that seafood made us hungry for sushi!  So wrong, but whatever!

The first thing I noticed when I walked in was that everyone was speaking Japanese so that was a good sign.  All four people inside were Japanese and the portions of the nigiri were nice and substantial.  

Good prices, large portions and a nice low key vibe - definitely will be coming back!
author: Gene X.

description:
i absolutely love this place that it has now become my go-to sushi hot spot!

The seating is a bit cramped if you sit at the tables so I prefer to sit at the bar. The staff are super friendly, but the Japanese owner is probably the funniest and friendliest sushi chef you can come by! He loves to watch all types of sports ranging from football, to basketball and even baseball, so there's always something to talk about when you're seated at the bar. He will sometimes hook it up with free small appetizers if it's slow too.

I love how the fish is super fresh. I always get the Alaskan roll, negitoro, or the hamachi sashimi. My boyfriend usually gets the chirashi bowl, which has an assortment of different types of fish over rice. The bowl looks small, but don't let it's looks fool you, because the bowl is pretty deep that it actually gets him pretty full and leaves him satisfied by the end of the night. It also comes with miso soup and a really refreshing side salad that I'm not quite sure what it's made of but it's really tasty and light. We've been to a couple different sushi spots, and this place is probably the best deal you can find for a chirashi bowl in the city. It has a wider variety of fish compared to a lot of other places too.

I highly recommend you swing by this place because the sushi and food overall is amazing. Chat it up with the owner and buy him a drink, cause he's not shy about taking sake shots with you! You'll know he's already had a few if you walk in and his face is already red. Nothing but the best here. Kanpai!
author: Alexis A.

description: Akimo(monk fish liver) dish was palatable !
author: Boram K.

description: This restaurant is awesome!!! Definitely try sashimi and tanuki roll! Love the dessert too,ice cream is so nice. Tempura with little bit teriyaki sauce and kaki fry for appetizer  are great.couple asahi draft with friends will be perfect japanese restaurant to go. I also try the chicken teriyaki and see bass and salmon teriyaki here too, lol have dinner here almost everynight. Food are fresh and good!
author: Sunny W.

description:
Meh. Pretty average Japanese food (2 stars counts as average for our reviews).

Our main complaint was the spicy dragon roll wasn't particularly spicy at all and despite just listing "tuna" as an ingredient, instead came with cooked tuna which tasted more like canned tuna.  Not at all what we expected - which would be fine if this was an interesting variant, but the cooked meat just didn't work in the dish at all. And it was also drowned in way too much of a mayonnaise-ish sauce. A scallop roll wasn't much better.

 The grilled miso eggplant was just okay as well, with a sweet miso sauce. The agedashi tofu was decent, as was a cold noodle salad (especially for the price), but overall our meal only warranted 2 stars.
author: Amy D.

description:
Pretty standard Japanese fare -- nothing spectacular but decent. Sushi portions are relatively generous - hamachi nigiri was huge and the ikura was delish. The saba was also pretty good.

Don't really love the special rolls -- too many of them have tempura, eel, and imitation crab, all of which I avoid in sushi. For rolls, I prefer Chin's right across the street, but the nigiri was aiiiiite. I did like the grilled squid!
author: Nami S.

description: I was expecting much better japanese food.  prices are slightly higher than usual for a mediocre meal.  the place is small and the service is attentive.  it seems to be a go-to local neighborhood place but I can't say I'd ever go back.
author: n y.

description:
Good service, expensive chilled saki, rolls had no sauce. If you're into a dry roll it's really good. Sushi was 4 out of 10 period. Green tea ice cream could be better.
And I also forgot I rude they were about the the low tip!
Absolutely not cool!
author: Dean W.

description:
Pretty good rolls, some simple, some interesting. Fresh fish, attentive servers, fast service.
Nothing fancy, but this could definitely be a go-to place.
author: Stacy A.

description:
I've been here again recently and I have to say that it's really fallen off the wagon. DO NOT GO HERE. The food quality is so AWFUL. It doesn't even taste right anymore. 
The Japanese food here is AWFUL!!!

You have been warned.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
was here more than 2 months ago. Paid with my credit card, i just happened to check my credit card statement, the amount was different than what I wrote and signed on the receipt. Ummmmm,....someone might have 'entered" it wrong!! Its not alot, But its Not Right if that wasnt what I agreed to pay on wrote on the recipet. People, becareful, check your credit card statement just in case. =(

Btw not easy to find parking, of course, its richmond district.
author: Jenn J.

description: Went last night.  I felt something was off with the sushi combo platter.  Woke up this morning with loose stool, burping fish taste, and developed a fever.  Word of advice to the owners: giving your customer food poisoning is not a recipe for success!  Nuff siad
author: Massimo M.

description: One of my favorite sushi restaurants in SF and lucky to have it in my neighborhood. The Sushi Chefs are amazingly talented and super friendly. He oysters are awesome and it the veggie Udon Bowl is the best, especially in a cold winter's day. Plenty of veggie options as well.
author: Danielle B.

description: This restaurant is gorgeous and very classic. I love that they offer the basics but also have a special menu on the blackboard behind the sushi bar. The uni shooter is very unique and a must-try for you adventurous eaters out there. The sushi was fresh, sake selection was plentiful, and the service was quick and efficient and friendly. Best of all, this place has a lot of small tables good for groups up to 6-8 people. Highly recommend for dates or small friend gatherings!
author: Grace W.

description:
3.5 stars
First time coming here and I only tried the sushi. I do want to try other things in their menu as well.

We tried the tanuki roll and scallop lovers roll! Both were delicious. The scallop lovers roll had spicy tuna inside with raw scallops on top with a spicy mayo. Surprisingly delicious and it was unique that it was slightly warmed up so it tasted delicious. The tanuki roll had tempura, avocado, unagi and eggplant and it was melt in your mouth good. All the flavors together combined harmoniously. I can't wait to come back to try more good food!
author: Stella J.

description:
This restaurant reminds me when I was traveling in Japan.  However the portions are much larger!!  It's a small family run business.  

Price point is very reasonable and they gave us excellent service.  I have been going about the city trying out new places to eat and most places the food has been a 10, but their service was a 6.  

Nice sushi counter if you would prefer than having dinner at the table.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This place is always great with service. My UNI fix was delivered!!! The quality of the food is on spot. I haven't had a bad experience yet.
author: Valerie A.

description: Sat at the sushi bar and watched them do their magic. Everything was really fresh. Sushi chefs were friendly. A bit pricey but well worth it. Will definitely be back.
author: Goober S.

description: Don't get me wrong, the food is good... but it's not good enough to compensate for the terrible service. Usually, if the food is great, I don't mind a bit slower service with a touch of negligence, but this is just another good sushi place. We couldn't bring ourselves to finish the fish or rolls because we were annoyed by the lack of service. Definitely not the best sushi I ever had, and they are overpriced. Pretty disappointed. Positive: the tropical roll (mango & 2 types of tuna) is divine!
author: Horace G.

description: This is a great little Japanese restaurant.  It has a nice decor and ambience, great food cooked well and very nicely, friendly service, and reasonable prices.  San Francisco has some very expensive and ritzy Japanese places (to which I have not yet been), but for those seeking fairly normal prices, this is so far the best I've had in the city.
author: Wulfstan C.

description:
Grabbed a quick dinner here before a movie with my sister. After the postiive reviews, I HAD to give it a try as it is just down the street from my sis' apartment and I had never noticed it before.

I must confess, that my rating is based on two things alone. So yes, it's quite skewed.  :)

Easily....5 STARS for their Uni. Pretty much the most delish Uni I have had in a LONG time. Like all good Uni, it had that wonderful flavor of the ocean---not the least bit fishy but oh-so unctuous. :) Extremely cheap and fresh. You just can't beat that. 

2.5 STARS for the service. So ridiculously slow. The restaurant was not too busy when we were there and they had 3 servers on the floor. Plenty of staff considering the small size of the place.

Despite the service, I would gladly come back for the uni. I must confess that I'm a tad Sad Panda that we had just discovered it after nearly 10 years! :)
author: Nam N.

description: Came in on a weeknight and tried the nigiri combo.  Fish wasn't good and I had to douse it with soy sauce and wasabi to finish it.  So disappointed because many reviews on here say the sashimi is fresh but that wasn't the case for me.  The rolls and combination dinners for the rest of my table were ok though, so maybe just stick to cooked foods.
author: Renee L.

description:
Growing up in this area, I always passed by Tanuki, and felt compelled to try it out. It's somewhat off the main street, slightly secluded, makes a kitty curious you know?

Finally, the family decided to check it out, and I was not disappointed ^ ^

We were greeted and seated quite promptly and there was a surprise! One of the women who was a waitress was a waitress at one of our family favorite restaurants that had sadly closed down a few years prior. It was a wonderful surprise to see her again and brought a smile to everyone.

We ordered off a relatively simple menu, some good selection, not a huge array but enough for a good selection for everyone.

Ok, I must speak of this noodle salad appetizer they give. OH MY GODDDD I don't even know how it's made but its so wonderfully incredibly good I would order a giant bowl of it if I could. 

Sushi, really decent selection, and all of the different varieties we got were quite fresh and flavorful. Cooked dinner entrees were also cooked perfectly and quite full of flavor. Everything just felt fresh here which was very nice.

Service was quite friendly, very happy environment in the restaurant as it felt like the workers truly enjoyed working there.

Great experience, I only wish parking in the area was easier. No joke, parking here is incredibly tough! *cringe*

All in all, great place. I enjoyed it, Ill definitely be coming back :)

*chirp*
author: Jei C.

description: I rate four stars because of the staffs' service here although the foods weren't really my taste. I ordered a sushi and hot meal with udon from a special lunch menu. It came in a really big portion; six-piece spicy salmon and spicy tuna maki sushi, salmon, ebi, unagi sushi and one big bowl of udon (although I don't like a taste and smell snow pea left in the soup). Everything taste fine in average level. What else...? I might need to go there again cos the chef said "mata ne", which means see you again, to try other menu and see if it's better than my first time.
author: Yanakon D.

description: Long wait for the waitress to take our order. Another long wait for our sushi...at least 40 minutes after we ordered. The sushi chefs kept chatting instead of making the order. Two parties came in after us were done eating and left  before we got our sushi. Otherwise, sushi are ok but overpriced for the whole experience.
author: Elm E.

description:
4 solid stars.

I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. 

Nothing fancy or special about the place but definitely great sushi. Their fish is really fresh. Plus their lunch bento boxes are beautiful to look at and delicious to eat! I believe for the quality, it's decently priced.
author: Milly H.

description: un-fresh seafood with a lot of drunk dirty Japanese old guys...sitting around. Bad experience
author: Sarina L.

description:
I always pass this place but never really thought to try it before. Our regular go to sushi place was packed so in a pinch we decided to hit up Tanuki.

The rolls were decent but the real show stopper was the sashimi!! The sashimi was so fresh, tender and absolutely delicious. I'll be heading back to try more of the rolls. Judging from the other reviews, perhaps I ordered the wrong thing.

 I would highly recommend the trying Tanuki.
author: Leanne S.

description:
This is the best sushi restaurant in the area that I have been and might stay loyal to during lunch on weekdays.

My co worker and I are sushi fans. We have to have sushi for lunch at least once a week. We used to go to a 'sushi boat' concept restaurant on Clement and 5th (or 4th, cant remember) but their food is not that fantastic. 

Their sushi contains fresh fish and we love the lunch special (3 peices of salmon skin roll, 3 pieces of spicey tuna, 3 nigiris and a salmon kama) for $9.90. 

We always leave the place happy, satisfied and recharged!
author: Elly G.

description:
This Place HANDS DOWN is the best sushi I have eaten in the city!!!! I came across Tanuki when I was doing laundry one night a few months ago and I can't get enough!! 
The Sushi Chef is so welcoming and really makes you feel at home. He so nice and laid back. I actually share my sake or beer with him and sometimes he makes me a special roll just to say "Thank You" for coming in..Seriously who does that??

Now down to the Sushi...Honestly its always fresh and super Yummy..I love ordering off the chalk board the specials are just so unique and very tasty I often bring my friends to my new favorite sushi joint and they also agree that it is up there with the best sushi they have eaten in the city..

Well Done and Thank You I can't wait to go back
author: Tanya O.

description: Great place!!!! The new owner Tom took extra care of us!!! We ordered Sake Nigiri. Dragon Roll, vegetable Udin and cold Soba noodles.....yummmm! Extensive sake list!
author: Jhovani M.

description:
Don't order their grilled sea bass dinner, unless you're not hungry.  The portion is exceptionally small.

DO order their combination dinners.  Good food, well done.  The only thing is, I noticed the tuna sashimi left bloody puddles on the plate once I picked them up.  Not sure what that means.  They tasted fresh, though.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Above average sashimi. Salmon was divine, if you like salmon, just get the sake sashimi. Hamachi was thready, which might be okay in a roll, but not as sashimi.

The Uni Shot is divine; their uni is creamy and flavorful, but not overbearingly smoky.

Atmosphere was a little fast-foodish, but there was no space at the bar, so I had to take a table.

A great place if it's nearby, but I'll probably not return.
author: Cody K.

description: This Japanese restaurant the food is fresh, my friend with me like the food , the service vary good . Their sushi vary fresh.
author: Polly X.

description: Meh. Came here with my parents this afternoon. Ordered a hot meal/sushi combo, 2 pieces hamachi sashimi, tonkatsu/tempura combo, and tempura with soba noodles. All of the food was alright, nothing spectacular. My dad thought the sashimi wasn't fresh enough as the fish was kind of mushy. The tempura, tonkatsu, beef and soba were all pretty standard. Good, but not great. Service was a little slow although I could tell that the waiters were doing their best. Two waiters and one sushi chef for the whole restaurant. Not sure if i'd come back, there are a lot of other sushi places in SF.
author: Sannie L.

description:
We managed to grab the last table as we walked in, Just missed having to wait the 20 minutes for a free table since Tanuki is pretty small. 

I came here because I heard of their sashimi plates that are very resonably priced. I believe we got the 14 piece sashimi. I absolutely adore the combo. Good size portions, tasty, and, most importantly, very fresh. We also got a sukiyaki and it had jsutthe right amount of sweetness in it. We also got one roll and though I don't remember the name of it, I just remember that the fish on it was fresh.

Reasonbly priced, good sized portions, and fresh, fresh, fresh. I'll be back.
author: Jay L.

description:
*Noodle Salad: totally skippable. Smothered in buttery mayo. 
*Uni nigiri: fresh, buttery, delicious. 
*Sashimi combo: generous cuts, but at 14 pieces for $22, it better be. They also told me there was going to be octopus, which is my least favorite sashimi ever. So i asked to swap for the big scallops. I was super excited when the waitress told me that would be ok without extra cost. But when the platter came, I saw the octopus sashimi... 
*Futomaki roll: light and good, but nothing spectacular. 
*Deep fried crab: not as crispy as I normally like it. This was more in the style of tempura

Overall, it was fresh , but not sure if it was worth it, and def not noticeably better than other good sushi places around the inner/outer richmond area.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Just had a quick lunch at Tanuki with my father who is visiting from out of town. We've eaten at some of the best sushi restaurants in the world, both traditional style japanese cuisine and ornate fusion approaches. Tanuki is squarely located in the California sushi tradition, and all of its basics are executed to a high standard. The fish is fresh, flavorful, and deliciously tender. The rice is fragrant and perfectly prepared. There is but one waitress during lunch time attending to the whole restaurant, which means things move a bit more slowly. 

Tanuki's food is not ostentatious, but delicate and simple. Sometimes that's just what you're in the mood for, and today I was. I would happily come back to Tanuki with more friends!

Ps. we got the scallop lover, crab and avocado roll, uni shooters, tanuki roll, and bamboo roll. All were very tasty. Nothing in particular stood out, but everything was very solid. I would order each of them again.
author: Luke T.

description:
I am a fan! Even my Japanese friend recommends it!! That's gotta count for big points.  Ok, to be fair, I've only been there 3 times.  2/3 times my experience there was great, the 1 time... well, i'll call it a tempura tantrum.. keep reading..  

Let's start with the positive experiences shall we? (Check out my close up pics of the fish and oysters. YUM)

First of all, I've got a majorly weak stomach. So, I'm really picky about my sushi because sometimes I can get really sick. That being said, I was fine after my trips here :) Tanuki has great fresh fresh seafood.  Their portions on the fish are pretty good and meaty which doesn't make you cry when you order a sashimi combo. Their flavors are overall very clean and fresh. 

GOOD EATS
- various sushi/sashimi (hamachi, uni, saba, hirame)
- soft shell crab
- oysters on half shell
- seared tuna something
- gyoza (fresh handmade)

and that's all I've had because why get anything else?? the sushi is really good here. japanese owner, japanese friends thinks it's great and so do i! 

OK, want to know my bad experience? one time we got a tempura order. I swear, one of my 2 tempura prawns had no prawn in it.  i love shrimp, so no, i am NOT going to let this slip. It was like just a crispy long piece of batter.  Brought the waiter over and he looked at it and asked, "did you eat the shrimp?" I laughed and so of course, I was immediately deemed guilty. GUILTY. I said "uh.. no.. there was no shrimp".  After he gave me a dirty look and I gave him a "you gotta be kidding me" look we were given new tempura. Forreals though, did I eat it?? No!! 

NOTE: easy to miss this place as it's at the "triangle" meaning it's off the main road. The sign is a simple blue sign and the store front is a bit lacking.  Makes you kind of wonder if good sushi can come out of this place but it does! Overall, very small place but good food and good service... unless you have a tempura tantrum that is...
author: Eileen A.

description:
The fish is always fresh and the portions are always more than satisfying. I always get the sashimi dinner combo which comes with salmon, tuna and albacore (big slices). Their miso soup has godzilla-sized cubes of tofu.

They've also got good options for those that don't like raw fish. If you're looking for a japanese place and you love sushi but your friend doesn't, come here.
author: Will T.

description:
Tanuki is a small restaurant with room for around 20 people. There's a sushi bar with a small TV playing a sports game. The nice thing is it seems to be Japanese run. The service was pretty quick and nice.

The udon here was highly praised and for good reason. The egg and beef udon was pretty amazing. The udon noodles were tasty, but the beef wasn't that great. The broth wasn't salty and had a really strong mushroom taste to it. Overall, it was pretty good, but not as amazing as I thought it would be. 

After reading some many mixed reviews, I didn't expect the sushi to be any good. Despite that, I ordered a dish of sashimi. The appearance of the nicely cut red fish was really eye pleasing! True to how fresh it looked, it tasted really fresh! The texture was soft and it tasted amazing. So much goodness in one bite. Definitely, I'll have to come back here for sushi.
author: Steven B.

description:
Tanuki is disappointing in that I went with high expectations based on raving yelp reviews and that someone mentioned it's own by a Japanese couple.  But the truth is, I expect better food for this price. Or a cheaper bill for this sort of food. 

The rolls were mostly okay. But the uni tasted funky.  I didn't get sick afterwards or anything, but I felt queasy enough that it was as if I took a car ride in the windy roads for two hours.  How you can get motion sickness from less-than-fresh sushi, I don't know. The body is a mystery.

The other disappointment was the shiitake mushroom nigiri. The mushroom was fried! I have never seen it fried before and while most food taste better fried, shiitake is not one in my book.

I did like the daily special chawamushi a lot. Tender egg custard with a great flavor of umami. It's certainly much fancier than what I am able to make at home. Finally, good $6 spent. 

I'd say that if it wasn't for the big bowl of edamame, I would have left hungry, after spending around $60 for two people.  Thinking about what that can get me, for example, a beautiful chirashi bowl at Ebisu or something, makes me feel crappy that I wasted money and calories here.
author: Candice B.

description: I ordered the Scallop lover and Tokyo rolls. Both were really good and fresh. The Tokyo was half the price of the scallop and was better to me. Oh well it was a very good meal. I also got an oyster shit which was delicious!!
author: Tony D.

description: One of the go-to spots for me and my sweetie. The tables are intimate (parties larger than six may present a problem), but service is usually swift. Its position on California rather than Clement or Geary allows an escape from the drunken hordes The selection is varied - I seldom dislike an item, and often choose new ones to experiment with my taste buds. I'm partial to anything crab or calamari, while Sweetie is more into the slightly spicy rolls. The tea is always hot, but not too hot to drink right away.
author: Marcus M.

description:
Ok, so maybe I'm a sucker for sushi places as I've been handing out 5 stars like nothing, but Tanuki is worth the drive to Richmond. Only downside is the slow service, but will get to that later. I guess in that sense, I'd give 4.5 stars for this review.

The food was in no way a reflection of the service here. All of the fish was fresh and exactly how sashimi should be. We also had the dinner combination with Tempura And Sukiyaki. The tempura had vegetables not included in usual tempura assortments, such as eggplant and sweet potato. The sukiyaki was perfectly cooked and had a delicious sauce, like the kind you just want to drown your rice bowl in. The sukiyaki also included some soft tofu and veggies that complemented the beef. The large portion of the hamachi kama was also very will grilled and meaty!

The only thing to really note at Tanuki is the slow service. For some reason, the wait staff would pass by us when we clearly wanted to order or wanted to pay our bill and no one would pay any attention to us for a few minutes. It was odd, but I guess cleaning the table next to us is a higher priority than taking our order.
author: Angela S.

description:
I am so delighted Tanuki satisfies my sushi cravings.  This is a favorite Japanese sushi bar.  The sushi chef, kitchen chef and wait staff are Japanese.  They must have excellent fish vendors.  All their fish is fresh and not previously frozen, which should be standard practice for all sushi bars.  

I typically order sashimi, nigiri or chirashi, but rarely order rolls unless it's a natto temaki/handroll.  I appreciate the little fine touches like wakame appetizer, perfect green tea and miso soup.  Tempura is lightly battered and crispy with grated radish and ginger for the tempura sauce.  The uni is fresh.  The sushi prices are average with delicious lunch specials.
author: HY L.

description:
Great restaurant! 

I ordered the sashimi and tempura combination. The food was delicious and perfect portioned. Given that the restaurant is small the service was fast which is a plus. It's a busy restaurant so get there before the crowd or make reservations. Also, the parking is a nightmare. 

I highly recommend this restaurant =)
author: Mscee M.

description: I've been eating at this restaurant for quite many many years and since the change of ownership, service levels have definitely dropped, as well as, the taste of the food.  I must say that I was disappointed.  Aki-san...you are missed!
author: Nancy L.

description: My wife and I have been coming here 23 years. We are convinced it is the BEST sushi in SF. Aki has been the head chef since then and the high quality sushi always satisfies!  We also love the quiet neighborhood atmosphere...
author: David B.

description: Pretty average food that doesn't warrant the price. Oh, and the waitress tried to charge more than we ordered. Good thing we caught that.
author: Anthony C.

description:
My usual sushi spot, so this post will be bias.

Great overall place, nice and cosy.
