My friend and I wanted to go to dinner and My Tofu House was packed so we decided to Yelp something. Tanuki came up so we decided to give it a try.
It's a small place, but surprisingly, fits a good amount of people in there. After about a 10 minute wait, we were seated.
What we ordered.
Agedashi - I saw that Susy C. recommended this dish and that the sauce was separate from the tofu so I had to try it. I am glad I did because it is probably one of the best agedashi I have ever had.
Oyster Shooters - Quail egg, oyster, ponzu sauce, lemon. I was a little on the tangy side but I love citrus so awesome!
Harmony Roll - Nothing special but the scallops were good and fresh.
Vege Roll - Forgot the actual name of it but the meal could have done without it.
Sashimi Dinner - Since my friend wanted soup and I wanted sashimi, we ordered a sashimi dinner as well. The dinner came with tuna, white tuna, salmon and hamachi. All good. All fresh. All melts in my mouth and not in my hands.
Hot Sake - Of course, it is not a true japanese meal without some hot sake. The small only gets about 3 shots, but 1.5 shots each was good enough for a dinner.
I will have to come here a lot more since it is so close to home.
author: Jimmy N.

description: my favorite japanese restaurant in san francisco.
author: Su K.

description: the mom, bf and i were home on xmas eve. its xmas eve! we shouldn't be cooking, so i yelped and found Tanuki. called and they were open. yay! it is a cute cozy little place.. the chicken teriyaki was fried, not grilled like the usual. we got little pocket calendars since we had dinner there on xmas eve. the sushi wasn't anything special, so i probably won't be returning.
author: Nancie T.

description: Really like this place. Tried the seafood udon and the broth was light and delicate, and not too salty. Nigiri was sized just right, and not Texas big. On a weeknight, it was wonderfully calm and quiet. Service was therefore quite attentive without being suffocating. Calm and chill, with freshness obvious - a solid choice.
author: Lemon S.

description: This is certainly a neighborhood gem.  My husband and I really enjoyed everything on our first visit: the food, the service, the atmosphere, the generous portion, and reasonable price.  The Hamachi Kama was grilled and seasoned to perfection.  The only item we didn't care for too much was the Ahi Poke roll which was a little plain and ordinary.  Still, I can't wait to come back here and introduce Tanuki to my dad, who has a great taste for Japanese cuisine
author: Nadine M.

description: this is becoming one of my new favorite neighborhood restaurants.  good rolls and sukiyaki, comfortable environment, and friendly staff.  try it out!
author: Conny W.

description: it was ok...that's really all i can say.  nigiri pieces were not well cut and definitely not as fresh as they could be.  it really was hit or miss w/the rolls too...some were great, i would stick with the spicy hamachi rolls but some were pretty boring and looked like you could have gotten it out of a ready pack at the grocery store.  service was friendly and fast, prices were decent but i will probably never go back...there are way too many better sushi places out there.
author: Janet K.

description: Most of my favorite Sushi places seem to be closed on a Monday, so I went on Yelp for some research. This place looked interesting and looked worthy of a punt. And boy was I happy with the choice! The albacore melted on my tongue, the lobster hand roll special was very reasonable and delicious, and so was pretty much everything else. Add to that a friendly and very Japanese sushi chef who must have thought we looked like ankimo fans (he was right). Out of the goodness of his heart (I guess?) he handed us a delicious plate of ankimo and mushrooms. It was grilled with a delicate ponzu sauce over it, paired with shavings of red and green onion. Will definitely go back.
author: Don J.

description: BEST Japanese restaurant in San Francisco!  I have been eating there for 17 years.  Nothing else compares.
author: Mobee A.

description: Its my favorite sushi spot in the city...great fish, great service, great little flat screen so that you can sit at the bar to watch games.
author: Sophie M.

description: I love Tanuki!  It's so nice to go there and enjoy the amazing sushi.  Whoever is their fish buyer is a genius.  This is by far the best sushi I've had outside Japan.
author: Dave B.
